unnormalised: **Automotive News: Understanding Recent Vehicle Launches in India**
normalised: **Automotive News: Understanding Recent Vehicle Launches in India**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market has witnessed a flurry of exciting vehicle launches in recent weeks, offering consumers a broader range of choices than ever before. Dr. Meena Iyer, Head of Automotive Engineering at IIT Madras, emphasizes the importance of understanding the underlying technology.
normalised: The Indian automotive market has witnessed a flurry of exciting vehicle launches in recent weeks, offering consumers a broader range of choices than ever before. Doctor Meena Iyer, Head of Automotive Engineering at I I T Madras, emphasizes the importance of understanding the underlying technology.

unnormalised: Recent launches include the Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara (Rs. 10.45 Lakh onwards), boasting hybrid technology for improved fuel efficiency, and the Mahindra Scorpio-N (Rs. 11.99 Lakh onwards), a rugged SUV designed for both urban and off-road adventures. Tata Motors also unveiled the Altroz iCNG, marking a significant step towards alternative fuel vehicles.
normalised: Recent launches include the Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara (rupee ten point four five lakh onwards), boasting hybrid technology for improved fuel efficiency, and the Mahindra Scorpio-N (rupee eleven point nine nine lakh onwards), a rugged S U V designed for both urban and off-road adventures. Tata Motors also unveiled the Altroz i C N G, marking a significant step towards alternative fuel vehicles.

unnormalised: Experts are highlighting the increased focus on safety features, with many new models incorporating advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS). Before making a purchase, consider your specific needs – city commuting, long drives on the NH44, or transporting goods. Also, remember to check the boot space (measured in liters) and compare it to your typical luggage requirements. Many showrooms now offer expanded display areas, some exceeding 5000 sq ft, allowing for a more comprehensive viewing experience. Drive safe!
normalised: Experts are highlighting the increased focus on safety features, with many new models incorporating advanced driver-assistance systems (A D A S). Before making a purchase, consider your specific needs – city commuting, long drives on the N H forty four, or transporting goods. Also, remember to check the boot space (measured in liters) and compare it to your typical luggage requirements. Many showrooms now offer expanded display areas, some exceeding five thousand square feet, allowing for a more comprehensive viewing experience. Drive safe!
